subject: Home & DIY
title: Greywater: Using Water Twice
description: A quick, practical guide to Greywater: Using Water Twice.

hook.text: Water from your shower, sink, and washer is called greywater. Too dirty to drink, but perfect for irrigation.

buildup.text: Greywater is 50-80% of household wastewater. Sending it to gardens reuses water that would flow to the sewer.

discovery.text: Simple systems divert laundry water straight to fruit trees. No treatment neededâ€”soil filters and breaks down soap.

twist.text: Greywater laws vary wildly. Some states offer rebates; others ban it, treating all wastewater the same.

climax.text: In drought-prone regions like California and Australia, greywater systems reduce outdoor water use by 50% or more.

punchline.text: Your shower water could grow your garden tomorrow.
